questiontext.text:
Find the values of x for which the following matrix has no inverse :

$$\small \begin{pmatrix}-3 &-5 &4 \\x &-5 &-1 \\-4 &x &4\end{pmatrix}\:$$

Express the answers upto 3 significant figures and in increasing order such that x1 < x2

x1 ={1:NUMERICAL:=-5.9349:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}x2 ={1:NUMERICAL:=1.6849:0.05#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

generalfeedback.text:
When a matrix has no inverse, the determinant of the matrix is equal to 0. So,

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-3 &-5 &4 \\x &-5 &-1 \\-4 &x &4\end{vmatrix}\: = 0$$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$ \small-3((-20) - (-1x)) - (-5)((4x) - (4) + (4)(x^{2} - (20)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small4x^{2}+17x-40 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-5.9349$$
$$\small x_{2} =1.6849$$

$$\small \begin{vmatrix}-4 &-4 &-4 \\x &-4 &-4 \\-3 &x &-2\end{vmatrix}\: = 0$$

On solving the determinant we get the following equation :

$$ \small-4((8) - (-4x)) - (-4)((-2x) - (12) + (-4)(x^{2} - (12)) = 0 $$

On simplifying the equation, we get

$$\small-4x^{2}-24x-32 = 0 $$

Solving for x, we get:

$$ \small x_{1} =-4$$
$$\small x_{2} =-2$$
